attributes.action: Remove the Hazard Perception Component of the Theory Test
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The Hazard Perception Component of the Theory Test is:

Un-realistic: You are not given the same view point as if you were driving in a car.

Unfair: You are penalised for clicking too early if you identify a hazard earlier than what the test sets as relevant response time; and you completely fail the test if you fail one component.

Poor Quality: The image of the hazard perception test video's are of poor quality and make it very difficult for you to identify potential hazards at a distance, e.g. signalling vehicles, pedestrians, cyclists.

Costly: Having to pay a sum of £28.50 to sit the theory test each time has no justification other than being a source of revenue for the government.

I propose the Hazard Perception Component be abolished in favour of returning to the standard theory test, it is unfair, un-representative of the true conditions whilst driving and is costly.
